text: In the pre - pandemic period , median duration of PICU stay was longer ( 19 days ) , and children were more often diagnosed with encephalitis / encephalopathy ( 25 % ) and co - infections ( 65 % ) than in later periods ( Table 7 ) . The proportion of children with influenza - associated pneumonia was highest ( 74 % ) during the pandemic , whereas secondary bacterial pneumonia ( 17 % ) , bronchitis / bronchiolitis ( 12 % ) and sepsis ( 6 % ) were reported less frequently during the pandemic than in the pre - and post - pandemic seasons . Oseltamivir treatment decreased significantly in the post - pandemic period ( Table 7 ) .
